title: How to watch Groundhog Day online: stream the classic Bill Murray movie anywhere
author: james-laird
summary: Take a trip to Punxsutawney wherever you are in the world
article: Groundhog Day has been and gone in 2021, with the world's most famous woodchuck Punxsutawney Phil predicting six more weeks of winter this year - giving you plenty of time to bunker down with one of the best comedy movies of all-time and learn more about one North America's more curious traditions. Read on as we explain how to watch Groundhog Day online and stream the movie, wherever you are in the world right now.

Starring Bill Murray and Andie MacDowell, the 1993 time-loop classic is widely available on global streaming services, many of which offer trial periods that essentially mean you can watch Groundhog Day free online, if that's what you choose.

The film follows cranky big city weatherman...wait for it, Phil (Murray), who arrives in Punxsutawney keen to complete a quickfire story on February 2's groundhog-related festivities - and hope not to draw the short straw again next year, as he initially despises the town and regards its inhabitants.

Instead, he finds himself stuck in a time-loop constantly waking up to February 2 again and again. As the story progresses, he's increasingly drawn to his good-natured production assistant Rita (MacDowell), and rather than making crude passes at her as before, slowly starts falling in love.

That's all we'll say for now, as this is a movie that literally repeats itself, so whether you're in Gobbler's Knob or anywhere else on the planet, here's how to watch Groundhog Day online and take a trip to Punxsutawney!
Unfortunately, if you’re out of your country of residence for whatever reason, then geo-blocks will prevent you from connecting to your streaming services and content back home.

Luckily, there’s a simple fix. Downloading a VPN will let you to change your IP address to that of any country in the world: meaning you can access your preferred VOD platform online from anywhere – just like you would in your own living room.
